First, we have to find out the market value of debt which we denote with $MD$, where the par value $PV$ is $1,000$, selling rate $SR$ is $108\%$ and the bonds $B$ is $15,000$

$$\begin{align*}
MD&=PV \times SR \times B\\[7pt]
&=1,000 \times 108\% \times 15,000\\[7pt]
&=1,000 \times 1.08 \times 15,000\\[7pt]
&=16,200,000
\end{align*}$$

So, the market value of debt is $\boxed{\$16,200,000}$

Second, we have to find out the market value of the common stock which we denote with $MC$, where the outstanding share $OS$ is $575,000$ and the per-share selling $PS$ is $64$

$$\begin{align*}
MC &=OS \times PS\\[7pt]
&=575,000 \times 64\\[7pt]
&=36,800,000
\end{align*}$$

So, the market value of common stock is $\boxed{\$36,800,000}$

Third, we have to find out the actual value of the preferred stock which we denote with $AP$, where the shares $S$ is $35,000$ and the per-share selling $PS$ is $65$

$$\begin{align*}
AP&=S \times PS\\[7pt]
&=35,000 \times 65\\[7pt]
&=2,275,000
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual value of preferred stock is $\boxed{\$2,275,000}$

Fourth, we have to find out the total value of the firm which we denote with $TF$, where the market value of debt $MD$ is $\$16,200,000$, the market value of common stock $MC$ is $\$36,800,000$ and the actual value of preferred stock $AP$ is $\$2,275,000$

$$\begin{align*}
TF&=MD+MC+AP\\[7pt]
&=16,200,000+36,800,000+2,275,000\\[7pt]
&=53,000,000+2,275,000\\[7pt]
&=55,275,000
\end{align*}$$

So, the total value of firm is $\boxed{\$55,275,000}$

Fifth, we have to find out the cost of equity which we denote with $CE$, where the risk-free rate $R$ is $3.2\%$, risk premium $RP$ is $7\%$ and the beta $B$ is $1.09$

$$\begin{align*}
CE&=R +(RP \times B) \\[7pt]
&=3.2\% + (7\% \times 1.09)\\[7pt]
&=0.032 + (0.07 \times 1.09)\\[7pt]
&=0.032 +0.0763\\[7pt]
&=0.1083\\[7pt]
&=10.83\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the cost of equity is $\boxed{10.83\%}$

Sixth, we have to find out the yield to maturity of the bond semi-annual by using the excel sheet which we denote with $YTM$, where the number of years $NPER$ $(25 \times 2)$ is $50$, $PMT$ is $29$, par value $PV$ $(1000 \times 1.08)$ is $-1080$ and the face value $FV$ is $1000$

$$\begin{align*}
YTM &=RATE(NPER,PMT,PV,FV)\times 2\\[7pt]
&=RATE(50,29,-1080,1000)\times 2\\[7pt]
&=5.22\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the yield to maturity of a bond is $\boxed{5.22\%}$

Seventh, we have to find, out the after-tax cost of debt which we denote with $AD$, where the yield to maturity of debt $YD$ is $5.22\%$ and the tax rate $TR$ is $21\%$

$$\begin{align*}
AD&=YD \times (1-TR)\\[7pt]
&=5.22\% \times (1-21\%)\\[7pt]
&=0.0522\times (1-0.21)\\[7pt]
&=0.0522 \times 0.79\\[7pt]
&=0.0412\\[7pt]
&=4.12\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the after tax cost of debt is $\boxed{4.12\%}$

Eighth, we have to find out the price of preferred stock $PS$, where the outstanding preferred stock $OP$ is $2.8\%$ and the per-share selling $PS%$ is $65$

$$\begin{align*}
PS&=\frac{OP}{PS}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{2.8\%}{65}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.028}{65}\\[12pt]
&=4.30\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the price of preferred stock is $\boxed{4.30\%}$

Finally, let's find out the weighted average cost of capital which we denote with $WC$, where the cost of equity $CE$ is $10.83\%$, market value of common stock $MC$ is $\$36,800,000$, the total value of the firm $TF$ is $\$55,275,000$ after-tax cost of debt  $AD$ is $4.12\%$, actual value of preferred stock $AP$ is $\$2,275,000$,  price of preferred stock $PS$ is $4.30\%$ and the market value of debt $MD$ is $\$16,200,000$

$$\begin{align*}
WC&=\bigg(CE \times \frac{MC}{TF}\bigg) + \bigg(AD\times \frac{MD}{TF}\bigg) + \bigg(PS \times \frac{AP}{TF}\bigg)\\[12pt]
&=\bigg(10.83\% \times \frac{36,800,000}{55,275,000}\bigg) + \bigg(4.12\%\times \frac{16,200,000}{55,275,000}\bigg)\\[12pt]&\phantom{=} + \bigg(4.30\% \times \frac{2,275,000}{55,275,000}\bigg)\\[12pt]
&=\bigg(0.1083 \times \frac{36,800,000}{55,275,000}\bigg) + \bigg(0.0412\times \frac{16,200,000}{55,275,000}\bigg)\\[12pt]&\phantom{=} + \bigg(0.0430 \times \frac{2,275,000}{55,275,000}\bigg)\\[12pt]

&=0.0721+0.0120+0.00176\\[7pt]
&=0.0858\\[7pt]
&=8.58\%
\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the weighted average cost of capital is $\boxed{8.58\%}$
